chat.text: ‚ö†Ô∏è I tested Google Bard. It was surprising -- in a bad way | ZDNET - https://www.zdnet.com/article/i-tested-google-bard-it-was-surprising-in-a-bad-way/

I tested Google Bard. It was surprising -- in a bad way | ZDNET

Google Bard, a new AI chatbot, has been criticized for being unable to answer simple textbook questions. The chatbot has also been criticized for not providing sources when asked for certain information. However, the chatbot could prove useful for career building tools such as resume, cover letter, and essay generating.

- Google Bard is a new AI chatbot that was recently released.
- The chatbot has been criticized for its inability to answer simple textbook questions.
- The chatbot also does not provide sources when asked for information.
- Unlike other chatbots that do interactive prompts, Google Bard does not.
- Google Bard, however, could prove useful for career building tools such as resume, cover letter, and essay generating.
- The chatbot has been praised for doing a good job at providing some basic information for a resume.

- VSCode —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è –±–µ—Å–ø–ª–∞—Ç–Ω—ã–º –∏ open source —Ä–µ–¥–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º; –ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –º–æ–≥—É—Ç –ø–æ–ª—É—á–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É –æ—Ç –æ–±—à–∏—Ä–Ω–æ–π –±–∏–±–ª–∏–æ—Ç–µ–∫–∏ —Ä–∞—Å—à–∏—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–π.

chat.text: ‚ö†Ô∏è Twitter reveals some of its source code, including its recommendation algorithm | TechCrunch - https://techcrunch.com/2023/03/31/twitter-reveals-some-of-its-source-code-including-its-recommendation-algorithm/

Twitter reveals some of its source code, including its recommendation algorithm | TechCrunch

Twitter has revealed a portion of its source code, including the algorithm it uses to recommend tweets in users' timelines, on GitHub as a "first step to being more transparent". However, the open source releases do not include "any code that would compromise user safety and privacy or the ability to protect our platform from bad actors" nor instructions on using the code. A Twitter engineer said the algorithm labels authors as Republicans or Democrats for metrics, which CEO Elon Musk claimed "definitely shouldn't be dividing people".
